title: Ahmed Qurei, Former Palestinian Premier and Peace Envoy, Dies at 86
description: A member of the old guard of Palestinian leaders, Mr. Qurei was a principal architect of the Oslo Accords, the first peace agreement with Israel.

title: To Heal Brexit Wound, U.K. and E.U. Strike a Northern Ireland Trade Deal
description: A dispute left over from the Britain-European Union split has chilled relations, paralyzed Northern Ireland’s government, risked a trade war and even caused friction between London and Washington.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: U.S. Treasury Secretary Visits Kyiv
description: Also, Britain and the E.U. agree on a Northern Ireland trade deal and winter devastates Afghanistan.

title: Biden Dispatches Yellen and Blinken to Bolster Support for Ukraine
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen traveled to Kyiv the day before Secretary of State Antony Blinken was to visit Central Asia in a show of American solidarity with Ukraine in its battle with Russia.

title: Migrant Deaths Shine Light on Europe’s Broken Promises
description: At least 63 people died in a shipwreck off Italy’s coast, reviving memories of a crash in 2013 that killed hundreds and the work that did not get done in its aftermath.

title: An Elf? A Witch? Mexico’s President Says It’s the Mythical Aluxe
description: President Andrés Manuel López Obrador tweeted an image of what he said was an aluxe, a legendary elflike creature. News outlets said it looked like a 2021 photo of another questionable creature.

title: In Central Asia, Blinken Will Urge Distance From Russia, and Ukraine War
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken will make the first diplomatic trip by a Biden administration cabinet official to the former Soviet republics of Central Asia since the Ukraine war began.

title: Betty Boothroyd, Britain’s First Female House of Commons Speaker, Dies at 93
description: The speaker made Britain’s parliamentary proceedings must-see TV, even in other countries.

title: King Charles Met E.U. Leader Ahead of New Brexit Deal, Sparking Controversy
description: Some said the meeting conflicted with the king’s apolitical role because it came at the time Ursula von der Leyen, president of the European Commission, was finalizing the new Brexit deal.

title: What Is the Northern Ireland Protocol? The Brexit Deal Changes, Explained
description: Britain and the European Union have long clashed over post-Brexit rules known as the Northern Ireland protocol. Here’s what to know about the renegotiated agreement.

title: Northern Lights Seen Across the U.K. in Rare Show
description: The sight, which usually involves a trip to a snowy outpost, could be seen in the south of England.

title: Live Updates: Britain and E.U. Said to Agree on Northern Ireland Trade Deal
description: The agreement, reported by British news media outlets, may resolve one of the most poisonous legacies of Brexit, Britain’s fraught exit from the European Union.

title: Turkey’s Earthquake Zone Is a Lot Like California’s. Here’s What That Means.
description: The country’s recent disaster could offer clues about the potential strength and location of future West Coast quakes.

title: Manish Sisodia, an Indian Opposition Leader, Is Arrested on Corruption Charges
description: The corruption charges follow a bitter fight between India’s governing party and a regional competitor with national ambitions.

title: U.S. Commandos Advise Somalis in Fight Against Qaeda Branch
description: A campaign in the Horn of Africa is now the most active element in the “forever wars” the United States has waged since the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.

title: A New 5.2-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Turkey
description: The latest temblor, measuring 5.2 in magnitude, shook parts of the same area stricken by a far stronger quake on Feb. 6 that killed more than 50,000 people in the country and in neighboring Syria.

title: Revenge Attacks After Killing of 2 Israeli Brothers Leave West Bank on Edge
description: Settlers burned and vandalized hundreds of cars and homes in four Palestinian villages, according to Israeli rights groups and Palestinian officials, and the area was braced for more violence.

title: Live Updates: Russia Targets Ukraine With Overnight Drone Strikes
description: Ukrainian officials said at least two people were killed in an hourslong series of attacks by Russian drones. Most were shot down, Ukraine said.

title: What Is the Northern Ireland Protocol?
description: Britain and the European Union have long clashed over post-Brexit rules known as the Northern Ireland protocol. Here’s what to know about their renegotiation.

title: The Phone in the Room
description: We examine the raging debate about smartphones and teenage mental health.

title: Dying Children and Frozen Flocks in Afghanistan’s Bitter Winter of Crisis
description: Hundreds have died in plunging temperatures, and malnutrition has been rampant, even as the Taliban government’s ban on female workers has hampered international aid.

title: Is There an Ethical Way to Kill Rats?
description: Welcome to the rat trapper’s dilemma.

title: Russia’s New Offensive Sends Conscripts Into the Teeth of Ukraine’s Lines
description: A month into the campaign, Russian forces have barely budged despite forays by small units in fields, pine forests and ruined towns.

title: China Dismisses Latest Claim That Lab Leak Likely Caused Covid
description: The response came after the Energy Department concluded with “low confidence” that the coronavirus emerged from a lab in Wuhan, China.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: The effects of the war in Ukraine on Europe.

title: Lab Leak Most Likely Caused Pandemic, Energy Dept. Says
description: The conclusion, which was made with “low confidence,” came as America’s intelligence agencies remained divided over the origins of the coronavirus.
